title: Bored of losing to players 10 times better than me
body:
Normals is a shit show right now. Constantly being placed vs people who either destroy me or I destroy them and no in between. A few games ago the lobby had someone every rank from bronze to daimond. This is ridiculous. It punishes people who just wanna play league or just take a break from ranked. This has been going on since the beginning of season 6 with the introduction of this shitty matchmaking system. If a bronze wants to duo with someone from platinum whatever, but don't make me play against the platinum because that's just stupid.

Just a player tired of getting auto losses because the matchmaking system is based on a fallacy.

Edit: Just played a game that ended before 19 minutes.
The diamond (previously masters) and both platinums completely obliterated us. Not even close

>If a bronze wants to duo with someone from platinum whatever, but don't make me play against the platinum 

how do you fix that? lol

bronze + plat vs plat = sad bronze
bronze + plat  vs bronze = sad enemy bronze

They're trying to play with a friend who is at a level significantly above their skill level. You shouldn't punish 8 other people by giving them a bad experience in the game by having his friend be one of the only factors in the game. Forget playing against the good player for a second and think about the quality of game play you produce by mixing players with such distinctly varied skill levels. It inevitably becomes a crap show.

You wanna know the solution to where to place these players? Pair people who duo with players significantly better/worse them them with OTHER players who do the same thing. Don't punish players who duo with friends of similar skill or the solo queue players because of a decision someone else makes. Because right now the only place to play fair* matches is in ranked and I don't want to sucumb to the "not playing ranked to win" mentality because that's even worse.

Also at least pair the lanes correctly. Put the plat vs the other plat lane. Even if it is support, just extend their queue until a support comes out.
In blind it is a different issue.

2) MMR normal and ranked are different.

I would happily triple the wait time for a game if it ment that i could get a game where one team or another doesnt get 1 lane so fed by 15 mins that they can 1v3 under the turret.

You know this brings about a whole new perspective on things

Okay. Lets restart from scratch.

ELO is a generic name for a ranking system based on a "elo score" allowing you to rank people efficiently based on a win lose system. It's mainly used in chess, board games, video games.

MMR is the name RIOT gave to your ELO score and they keep it hidden. MMR = ELO score.

There is no question of "elo can be 0 sum in this situation and can"t in this situation", elo is a "SYSTEM", you can't change the rules of this system without breaking it hard.

Normal have the SAME ranking system as ranked games have, it's just a separate one and it doesnt tell you any fancy division or stuff like "you are gold, you are plat", but the real system behind normal mmr and ranked mmr works exactly the same way. If tomorow they want to add a rank to normal game they can do it in the blink of an eye, all the numbers are already there, you just have to display each player's mmr.

LP is never required to be 0 sum, LP and division are just fancy rewards so people can set up fancy goals while playing (at least fancier than saying "i'm going to aim for 2000 points), it breaks the goals in small steps and give medals to people.

The best proof LP doesnt follow a 0 sum algorithm is when someone dodges he loses LP and noone wins LPs. 

You can also see that LP can't follow a 0 sum system since there's a shifting to the left in "LP ranks" (aka the divisions) at the begining of the season and it pushes people to climb back.

tl;dr : elo = MMR, LP is not 0 sum, you mixed up everything.

Had the worst example of this happen to me a few games ago. I'm constantly getting put with and against plats and diamond level players in normals and it just sucks. I was up against a platinum Renekton one trick, on like my third time learning a new champion who proceeded to antagonize and cuss at me for not wanting to do anything in the lane. 

I mean I'm all for a challenge and learning from better players but it's no fun sitting under your tower farming while they attack your tower and still not being able to fight them because they can kill you under tower, or being denied with perfect lane freezing and punished for even the littlest mistake.

In many of my recent games, I've been the only bronze on my team, at least judging by borders. I've had 3 plats at once, an occasional diamond, and the rest gold's and silver's.

We stomped that game with three plats on my team, by the way.

That's what you get when everyone thinks "It's just normals." People don't care; sometimes they play their main at their best, because winning is fun, and sometimes they goof around and play random champions, because that's fun too. And since people aren't consistently competitive in normals, matchmaking is bound to be less accurate.

None of that is problem though. That's how it should be. People just need to realize it and deal with it. It's intended to be a less competitive queue, so we should accept that it's gonna be a little less balanced on average.

Auto-losses and stomps are still lame, but if you go into a normal game with lower expectations (like don't base your entire appreciation of the game on the end-result; winning doesn't matter, "it's just normals", right?) it can still be somewhat fun. Don't play normals to win. Play them to try something new, or to goof around with friends, or to just get one good fight or make one cool play. Or just follow the advice everyone's heard a million times already, and focus on your own play rather than the game at large. If matchmaking sucked and put you against diamonds, or your team just dicked off all game, whatever; personally you can still do well and have fun (before surrendering at 20), and maybe you'll learn a cool new trick from that diamond player.
